segment.source: SpeechRecognitionAudioProblem

segment.source: Learn how to manage issues with speech-recognition accuracy caused by audio-input quality.
segment.target: Learn how to manage issues with speech-recognition accuracy caused by audio-input quality.

segment.source: Assess audio-input quality
segment.target: Assess audio-input quality

segment.source: When speech recognition is active, use the RecognitionQualityDegrading event of your speech recognizer to determine whether one or more audio issues might be interfering with speech input.
segment.target: When speech recognition is active, use the RecognitionQualityDegrading event of your speech recognizer to determine whether one or more audio issues might be interfering with speech input.

segment.source: The event argument (SpeechRecognitionQualityDegradingEventArgs) provides the Problem property, which describes the issues detected with the audio input.
segment.target: The event argument (SpeechRecognitionQualityDegradingEventArgs) provides the Problem property, which describes the issues detected with the audio input.

segment.source: Recognition can be affected by too much background noise, a muted microphone, and the volume or speed of the speaker.
segment.target: Recognition can be affected by too much background noise, a muted microphone, and the volume or speed of the speaker.

segment.source: Here, we configure a speech recognizer and start listening for the RecognitionQualityDegrading event.
segment.target: Here, we configure a speech recognizer and start listening for the RecognitionQualityDegrading event.

segment.source: Manage the speech-recognition experience
segment.target: Manage the speech-recognition experience

segment.source: Use the description provided by the Problem property to help the user improve conditions for recognition.
segment.target: Use the description provided by the Problem property to help the user improve conditions for recognition.

segment.source: Here, we create a handler for the RecognitionQualityDegrading event that checks for a low volume level.
segment.target: Here, we create a handler for the RecognitionQualityDegrading event that checks for a low volume level.

segment.source: We then use a SpeechSynthesizer object to suggest that the user try speaking louder.
segment.target: We then use a SpeechSynthesizer object to suggest that the user try speaking louder.
